materials.details: Alexa Fluor 488 conjugate, Life Technologies (A21202), RRID:AB_141607

materials.name: CDBLY2
components: Transforming growth factor-α PHG0051 (Life Technologies) 10 ng/mL

materials.name: ITS (1,000×) stock
materials.details: 1 mL glacial acetic acid + 49 mL sterile water, filter sterilized with PES 0.22 µm syringe filter, 5 mL added to stock ITS bottle

params.note: Table 1: Primary and secondary antibodies for immunofluorescence characterization of PT-enhanced organoids. EpCAM: 1:300, SLC12A1: 1:400, LTL: 1:300, NEPHRIN: 1:300, Streptavidin-Alexa405: 1:500, Rabbit IgG-Alexa568: 1:500, Sheep IgG-Alexa647: 1:500.

Table 2: Primary and secondary antibodies for immunofluorescence characterization of PT-enhanced organoids. ECADHERIN: 1:300, CUBILIN: 1:300, MEGALIN: 1:300, LTL: 1:300–1:500, Streptavidin-Alexa405: 1:500, Mouse IgG-Alexa488: 1:500, Goat IgG-Alexa647: 1:500, Rabbit IgG-Alexa568: 1:500.

Table 3: CDBLY2 medium composition. Components: DMEM/F12, PenStrep (1%), Triiodothyronine (2.5 pg/mL), Hydrocortisone (0.1 µM), ITS (5 ng/mL), TGF-α (10 ng/mL), FGF9 (50 ng/mL), CHIR99021 (1 µM), DAPT (2.5 µM), BMP7 (10 ng/mL), LIF (5 ng/mL), Y27632 (10 µM).

ITS (1,000×) stock preparation: Mix 1 mL glacial acetic acid with 49 mL sterile water. Filter sterilize using PES 0.22 µm syringe-driven filter unit. Add 5 mL of acidified water to stock ITS bottle and swirl.
Cells are discarded if high levels of differentiation persist despite regular cleaning attempts. See Troubleshooting section.
